formalpara.title: Requirements
formalpara.para: Mork needs a properly installed Java 2 platform, version 1.2 or higher. A graphical user-interface is needed to run the installer. Make sure that JDK's bin directory is in your path. In most cases, 64MB of memory is enough do to run Mork. More memory is needed to compile complex mapping files or to run on 64 bit machines.

listitem.para: Download Mork. It is distributed as a Java installer class mork_x_y.class.

Enter the directory that holds mork_x_y.class.
cd /path/to/installer

Launch the installer.
java -cp . mork_x_y Note that mork_x_y is specified without the .class extension.
Make sure that bin/ is in your PATH.
Make sure that lib/mork.jar is in your CLASSPATH when compiling and running applications that use Mork.

Check your setup. Typing
mork should print Mork's usage message.

formalpara.title: Technical details
formalpara.para: The installer unpacks Mork, generates launch scripts, and fixes executable flags (Unix only). The installer does not touch or create files outside the install directory. It does not touch any system settings like PATH or CLASSPATH.

listitem.para: Remove the directory where Mork was installed.
Remove Mork jar files from your CLASSPATH.
Remove Mork scripts from your PATH.
